verses.text_plain: Deliver me from mine enemies, O my God: defend me from them that rise up against me.
verses.verse_html:
1Deliver me from mine enemies, O my God: defend me from them that rise up against me. ▼
▼ Al–taschith…: or, Destroy not
 , ▼
▼ Michtam: or, A golden Psalm
 , ▼
▼ defend…: Heb. set me on high

tokens.text: me from them that rise up

footnotes.body_html: ▼ Al–taschith…: or, Destroy not
▼ Michtam: or, A golden Psalm

footnotes.body_text: ▼ defend…: Heb. set me on high
footnotes.body_html: ▼ defend…: Heb. set me on high

verses.text_plain: Deliver me from the workers of iniquity, and save me from bloody men.
verses.verse_html: 2Deliver me from the workers of iniquity, and save me from bloody men.

verses.text_plain: For, lo, they lie in wait for my soul: the mighty are gathered against me; not for my transgression, nor for my sin, O Lord.
verses.verse_html: 3For, lo, they lie in wait for my soul: the mighty are gathered against me; not for my transgression, nor for my sin, O Lord.

tokens.text: For, lo, they lie in wait

verses.text_plain: They run and prepare themselves without my fault: awake to help me, and behold.
verses.verse_html:
4They run and prepare themselves without my fault: awake to help me, and behold. ▼
▼ help: Heb. meet

verses.text_plain: Thou therefore, O Lord God of hosts, the God of Israel, awake to visit all the heathen: be not merciful to any wicked transgressors. Selah.
verses.verse_html: 5Thou therefore, O Lord God of hosts, the God of Israel, awake to visit all the heathen: be not merciful to any wicked transgressors. Selah.

verses.text_plain: They return at evening: they make a noise like a dog, and go round about the city.
verses.verse_html: 6They return at evening: they make a noise like a dog, and go round about the city.

verses.text_plain: Behold, they belch out with their mouth: swords are in their lips: for who, say they, doth hear?
verses.verse_html: 7Behold, they belch out with their mouth: swords are in their lips: for who, say they, doth hear?

verses.text_plain: But thou, O Lord, shalt laugh at them; thou shalt have all the heathen in derision.
verses.verse_html: 8But thou, O Lord, shalt laugh at them; thou shalt have all the heathen in derision.

tokens.text: at them; thou shalt have all the heathen

verses.text_plain: Because of his strength will I wait upon thee: for God is my defence.
verses.verse_html:
9Because of his strength will I wait upon thee: for God is my defence. ▼
▼ defence: Heb. high place

footnotes.body_html: ▼ defence: Heb. high place

verses.text_plain: The God of my mercy shall prevent me: God shall let me see my desire upon mine enemies.
verses.verse_html:
10The God of my mercy shall prevent me: God shall let me see my desire upon mine enemies. ▼
▼ enemies: Heb. observers

verses.text_plain: Slay them not, lest my people forget: scatter them by thy power; and bring them down, O Lord our shield.
verses.verse_html: 11Slay them not, lest my people forget: scatter them by thy power; and bring them down, O Lord our shield.

verses.text_plain: For the sin of their mouth and the words of their lips let them even be taken in their pride: and for cursing and lying which they speak.
verses.verse_html: 12For the sin of their mouth and the words of their lips let them even be taken in their pride: and for cursing and lying which they speak.

verses.text_plain: Consume them in wrath, consume them, that they may not be: and let them know that God ruleth in Jacob unto the ends of the earth. Selah.
verses.verse_html: 13Consume them in wrath, consume them, that they may not be: and let them know that God ruleth in Jacob unto the ends of the earth. Selah.

verses.text_plain: And at evening let them return; and let them make a noise like a dog, and go round about the city.
verses.verse_html: 14And at evening let them return; and let them make a noise like a dog, and go round about the city.

verses.text_plain: Let them wander up and down for meat, and grudge if they be not satisfied.
verses.verse_html:
15Let them wander up and down for meat, and grudge if they be not satisfied. ▼
▼ for meat: Heb. to eat
 , ▼
▼ and grudge…: or, if they be not satisfied, then they will stay all night

tokens.text: Let them wander up and down

footnotes.body_html: ▼ for meat: Heb. to eat

footnotes.body_text: ▼ and grudge…: or, if they be not satisfied, then they will stay all night
footnotes.body_html: ▼ and grudge…: or, if they be not satisfied, then they will stay all night

verses.text_plain: But I will sing of thy power; yea, I will sing aloud of thy mercy in the morning: for thou hast been my defence and refuge in the day of my trouble.
verses.verse_html: 16But I will sing of thy power; yea, I will sing aloud of thy mercy in the morning: for thou hast been my defence and refuge in the day of my trouble.

tokens.text: for thou hast been my defence

verses.text_plain: Unto thee, O my strength, will I sing: for God is my defence, and the God of my mercy.
verses.verse_html: 17Unto thee, O my strength, will I sing: for God is my defence, and the God of my mercy.
